title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not include the description that more ATP (per glucose molecule) is produced by aerobic respiration.
The response includes the description that more ATP (per glucose molecule) is produced by aerobic respiration.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include an acceptable negative control. Acceptable negative controls include the following.

· The researchers must run the experiment without adding resveratrol.

· The researchers must treat the cells with DMSO alone.

The response includes an acceptable negative control. Acceptable negative controls include the following.

· The researchers must run the experiment without adding resveratrol.

· The researchers must treat the cells with DMSO alone.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not include an acceptable prediction. Acceptable predictions include the following.

· There will be no ATP production.

· There will be reduced ATP production.

The response includes an acceptable prediction. Acceptable predictions include the following.

· There will be no ATP production.

· There will be reduced ATP production.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not include the justification that, with an increase in the number of electron transport chain components, more electrons can be transferred so that more oxygen is required as the final electron acceptor.

The response includes the justification that, with an increase in the number of electron transport chain components, more electrons can be transferred so that more oxygen is required as the final electron acceptor.
